trans-unit.source: Provides attributes that can be used to write a custom HTTP handler for storing temporary image files.
Gets or sets the name of the custom handler.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> value that represents the name of the custom handler.
Gets or sets the directory of the custom handler where the temporary image files will be stored.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> value that represents the directory.
Gets or sets the folder which will be used for storing images in the specified directory.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> that represents the folder name.
Gets the handler type of the custom handler.
The <xref:System.Type> of the custom handler.
Gets a settings parameter with the specified name registered in the Web.config file under the `ChartHttpHandler` key.
Use this method to access any parameter in the Web.config file under the `ChartHttpHandler` key.
Name of the parameter to get.
Parameter value.
Gets a flag that indicates whether the handler will utilize private images.
When the PrivateImages property is set, the handler will not return images out of session scope.
In addition, the client will not be able to download another user's images.
This is the default behavior.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> if the handler will utilize private images, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the chart image storage type.
Chart images can be stored as files or in memory.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHttpHandlerStorageType"></xref> enumeration value that represents the chart image storage type.
Gets or sets the timeout of the custom handler.
When the timeout has expired, the stored chart image is overridden by a new chart image or discarded.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> enumeration value that represents the lifetime of the chart images.
Gets or sets the URL that corresponds to the HTTP path where temporary image files are stored.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> value that represents the URL.
